clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of Remote Glucose Monitoring Among Pediatric Patients With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Remote Glucose Monitoring Among Pediatric Patients With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This project explores the feasibility and utility of remote glucose monitoring for a cohort of children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes (T1D) cared for at UC Davis Health (UCDH).

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of remote glucose monitoring for pediatric T1D patients who receive care at UC Davis Health
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants who have successfully established remote glucose monitoring by the end of the baseline period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Initiation = 1 month after enrollment, Study completion = 7 months after enrollment
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c at study completion minus the HbA1c at initiation

secondary_outcome.description: Survey asking about patient's experience with data-sharing
Percentage of time spent in target glucose range (generated from continuous glucose monitor)
Percentage of time spent in hyperglycemic range (generated from continuous glucose monitor)
Percentage of time spent in hypoglycemic range (generated from continuous glucose monitor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall continuous glucose monitor (CGM) wear time
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent wearing continuous glucose monitor (generated from continuous glucose monitor)
Survey asking about patient's experience with remote patient monitoring

arm_group.description: All participants who have successfully established remote data-sharing from their glucose monitors to the research team's Glooko account by conclusion of the one-month baseline period will advance to the six-month intervention period.

intervention.description: Participants' glucose data will be monitored by the study team using population analytic reports. Participants who either have excessive hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia on these reports will be contacted by a pediatric endocrinologist (the principal investigator) to discuss any necessary adjustments to their home diabetes management plans. This intervention will be in addition to their usual care (regular visits at the UC Davis Pediatric Endocrinology clinic).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnoses of type 1 diabetes with a duration of greater than or equal to 12 months
- Use of a continuous glucose monitor (CGM) for greater than or equal to 6 months
- Intention to continue receiving care at the UC Davis Health Pediatric Diabetes clinic.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's CGM cannot be uploaded to Glooko
